sen.j: 長谷家（ながたにけ）は桓武平氏高棟王流で、西洞院時慶（従二位・参議）（1552年 - 1640年）の五男長谷忠康（正三位・民部大輔）（1612年 - 1669年）を祖とする堂上家。
sen.e: The Nagatani family, which claimed to be descended from the Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) TAIRA no Takamune-o line, belonged to the Tosho Family (high rank court noble families); the founder of the family was Tadayasu NAGATANI (Senior Third Rank, Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) (1612 - 1669), who was the fifth son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Junior Second Rank, Councillor) (1552 -1640).

The Nagatani family, which claimed to be descended from the Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) TAIRA no Takamune-o line, belonged to the Tosho Family (high rank court noble families); the founder of the family was Tadayasu NAGATANI (Senior Third Rank, Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) (1612 - 1669), who was the fifth son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Junior Second Rank, Councillor) (1552 -1640).

The Nagatani family, which claimed to be descended from the Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) TAIRA no Takamune-o line, belonged to the Tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks); the founder of the family was Tadayasu NAGATANI (Shosanmi Minbu taifu, or Senior Third Rank, Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) (1612 - 1669), who was the fifth son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Junii Sangi, or Junior Second Rank, Councilor) (1552 -1640).
sen.cmt: 「堂上家」「従二位・参議」「正三位・民部大輔」の表記を修正、米国スペルに統一するため、Councillor→Councilorとしました。(trans 1 comment参照)

sen.j: 後水尾天皇の側近だった西洞院時直（従二位・参議）（1584年 - 1636年）及び平松時庸（ときつね）（従二位・権中納言）（1599年 - 1654年）を兄とし、交野家の祖交野時貞（大膳大夫）は弟にあたる。
sen.e: Tokinao NISHINOTOIN (Junior Second Rank, Councillor) (1584 - 1636), who was a close retainer of Emperor Gomizunoo, and Tokitsune HIRAMATSU (Junior Second Rank, Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) (1599 -1654) were his elder brothers; Tokisada KATANO (Master of the Palace Table), the founder of the Katano family, was his younger brother.

Tokinao NISHINOTOIN (Junii Sangi) (1584 - 1636), who was a close retainer of Emperor Gomizunoo, and Tokitsune HIRAMATSU (Junii Gon Chunagon, or Junior Second Rank, Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) (1599 -1654) were his elder brothers; Tokisada KATANO (Daizen no daibu, or Master of the Palace Table), the founder of the Katano family, was his younger brother.
sen.cmt: 「従二位・参議」→Junii Sangiとし、既出のため補足削除、「従二位・権中納言」「大膳大夫」の表記を修正(trans 1 comment 参照)

sen.j: 家格は名家 (公家)、従二位・参議を極官とする。
sen.e: The social standing of the family was Meika, upper rank of court nobles; the top rank the family could attain was Junii Sangi (Junior Second Rank, Councillor).
